Segment description: The Mac segment includes Apple's line of personal computers. Segment description: The Services segment encompasses Apple's various service offerings, including licensed intellectual property, content, and distribution rights. The company manages supplier arrangements and supply chain commitments related to these services. The segment is also managed geographically to align with customer locations and market dynamics, contributing significantly to net sales and operating income.

Segment description: This segment includes Apple's products related to wearables, home devices, and accessories. Segment description: The iPad segment covers Apple's tablet products and related bundled software and services such as iCloud, Siri, and Maps. The company recognizes revenue based on performance obligations including hardware delivery and product-related services, allocating revenue accordingly.

Segment description: The iPhone segment includes Apple's smartphone products. Segment description: The Intelligent Cloud segment includes public, private, and hybrid server products and cloud services that support modern business and developers. It primarily consists of server products and cloud services such as Azure, GitHub, Nuance Healthcare cloud services, and enterprise and partner services including Enterprise Support Services and Microsoft Partner Network. This segment focuses on cloud infrastructure, AI offerings, server software, and professional services to enhance productivity and efficiency for IT professionals and developers.
Key products / services (keywords): Azure; GitHub; Nuance Healthcare; SQL Server; Windows Server; Visual Studio; System Center; Client Access Licenses (CALs); Enterprise Support Services; Industry Solutions; Nuance professional services; Microsoft Partner Network; Learning Experience; Server products and cloud services; Enterprise and partner services
Primary source: 10-K text snippet

Segment description: The More Personal Computing segment consists of products and services that focus on personal user experience with technology. It includes Windows OEM licensing and devices such as Surface and PC accessories, gaming through Xbox hardware and content including Xbox Game Pass and Xbox Cloud Gaming, and search and news advertising via Bing, Microsoft Edge, and Microsoft News. This segment aims to deliver consistent, personal computing experiences and expand gaming and advertising ecosystems.
Key products / services (keywords): Windows OEM licensing; Surface; PC accessories; Xbox hardware; Xbox content and services; Xbox Game Pass; Xbox Cloud Gaming; Bing; Copilot; Microsoft News; Microsoft Edge; Search and news advertising; Windows and Devices; Gaming
Primary source: 10-K text snippet

Segment description: The Productivity and Business Processes segment includes productivity, communication, and information services across various devices and platforms. It comprises Microsoft 365 Commercial and Consumer products and cloud services, LinkedIn with its Talent, Marketing, Premium, and Sales Solutions, and Dynamics products and cloud services including Dynamics 365 and low code platforms like Power Apps and Power Automate. This segment focuses on AI-powered business productivity, professional networking, and intelligent business applications.
Key products / services (keywords): Microsoft 365 Commercial; Microsoft 365 Copilot; Enterprise Mobility + Security; Power BI; Exchange; SharePoint; Microsoft Teams; Microsoft 365 Security and Compliance; Microsoft 365 Consumer; LinkedIn; Talent Solutions; Marketing Solutions; Premium Subscriptions; Sales Solutions; Dynamics 365; Power Apps; Power Automate; Microsoft 365 Commercial products and cloud services; Microsoft 365 Consumer products and cloud services; LinkedIn; Dynamics products and cloud services
Primary source: 10-K text snippet

Segment description: Google Cloud segment includes cloud computing services and infrastructure offerings. It is reported separately from Google Services and Other Bets, reflecting its distinct business focus within Alphabet. The segment's profitability and revenue are tracked independently to highlight its performance.
Primary source: 10-K Part I, Item 1 Business and Note 15

Segment description: Google Services segment encompasses a broad range of consumer and advertiser-facing products and platforms. This includes Google Search, YouTube advertising, Google Network, and Google subscriptions, platforms, and devices. The segment represents the core business operations generating significant revenue and operating income.
Key products / services (keywords): Google Search & other; YouTube ads; Google Network; Google subscriptions, platforms, and devices

Segment description: Other Bets segment includes Alphabet's experimental and emerging businesses outside of Google Services and Google Cloud. This segment typically operates at a loss and includes various projects and companies that are in development or early stages. It is reported separately to distinguish these ventures from the main business segments.
Primary source: 10-K Part I, Item 1 Business and Note 15

Segment description: AWS serves developers and enterprises of all sizes, including start-ups, government agencies, and academic institutions, by offering a broad set of on-demand technology services such as compute, storage, database, analytics, and machine learning. It also provides programs for content creators like authors, independent publishers, musicians, filmmakers, Twitch streamers, and app developers to publish and sell content. Additionally, AWS offers advertising services to sellers, vendors, publishers, and authors through sponsored ads, display, and video advertising.
Key products / services (keywords): AWS; sponsored ads; display advertising; video advertising
Primary source: AWS text snippet and revenue items

Segment description: The International segment includes fulfillment of customer orders through global fulfillment networks, co-sourced and outsourced arrangements, digital delivery, and physical stores. It supports sellers by enabling them to grow their businesses, sell products in Amazon stores, and fulfill orders using Amazon's services, earning fees from these seller programs. It also serves developers and enterprises through AWS and offers programs for content creators.
Primary source: International text snippet and revenue items

Segment description: The North America segment provides fast, free shipping on tens of millions of items, access to award-winning movies and series, live sports, and other benefits. Customer orders are fulfilled through North America and International fulfillment networks, co-sourced and outsourced arrangements, digital delivery, and physical stores. Customer service centers operate globally to support this segment.
Primary source: North America text snippet and revenue items

Segment description: The Family of Apps segment primarily generates revenue through selling advertising placements on its family of apps to marketers. These ads enable marketers to reach people across various marketing objectives such as generating leads or driving awareness. The segment focuses on helping people learn, get things done, create content, and connect with others through its platforms.
Primary source: SEC 10-K text snippet and revenue items

Segment description: Reality Labs is a segment designed to help people learn, get things done, create content, and connect with others, including through AI glasses and web-based experiences. While the segment is distinct from Family of Apps, it is reported separately and includes revenue items specific to Reality Labs.
Primary source: SEC 10-K text snippet and revenue items

Segment description: The Automotive segment focuses on AI model training and inference, data analytics, scientific computing, and 3D graphics with vertical-specific optimizations tailored for industries including automotive. It leverages NVIDIA's GPU technology to enable advanced automotive applications and virtual simulations.

Segment description: The Data Center segment accelerates compute-intensive workloads such as AI, data analytics, graphics, and scientific computing. It includes compute and networking solutions that scale to tens of thousands of GPU-accelerated servers, supporting modern AI applications. Key platforms include the Hopper computing platform for large language models and Spectrum-X ethernet platform for AI networking.
Key products / services (keywords): Compute; Networking; Hopper computing platform; Spectrum-X ethernet platform
Primary source: Data Center text snippet and revenue items

Segment description: The Gaming segment is rooted in NVIDIA's invention of the GPU, which revolutionized PC gaming and computer graphics. It includes products and software stacks that support gaming and compute-intensive applications, highlighted by the GeForce RTX 40 Series GPUs and CUDA programming model enabling parallel processing.
Key products / services (keywords): Gaming; GeForce RTX 40 Series GPUs; CUDA programming model

Segment description: The Professional Visualization segment delivers platforms combining processors, interconnects, software, algorithms, systems, and services to address markets requiring advanced visualization capabilities. It supports workloads in data center, gaming, professional visualization, and automotive markets.
